name: Sophos Cloud portal
comments:
Install Instructions:

Geoff Bernard Mon 10/31/2016 1:11 PM UTC-04 - Moncrief does not use UTG internally hosted Sophos like other customers.

To remove Symantec, do the following:
1.    First Log into Sophos Central Portal to confirm if computer has the Sophos client installed
Use creds below.
2.    If computer name shows up on list, go to Symantec Cloud to begin remote removal
https://hostedendpoint.spn.com/home.aspx
Username dgray@moncriefair.com pw 5Danielle!
3.    Once inside the Symantec portal click on the “computers’ tab at the top and click on the machine that you have confirmed has the Sophos client installed.  
4.    Once you have clicked the computer you want to remove Symantec on you will be taken to the Computer Profile page.  In here at the bottom right side you will see “Remove service” in red  Click on this to remove the Symantec cloud agent.  After this you can go back and click “Delete Computer” in red at the upper right hand side.
There are currently only 14 machines left with Symantec on the network.  The DC and TS servers will be done after hours during a maintenance window.  Out of the 14, 3 computer seem to have no longer connected to the network in a very long time and can probably be deleted.  Just confirm with Alex Hartley before removal.  Still follow the process of removing the service FIRST then delete the computer.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
